medical_history.chief_complaint: Epigastric and right upper quadrant pain, worse with eating.
medical_history.history_of_present_illness: Symptoms began two days prior to admission and have progressively worsened with eating. The patient experienced one episode of small volume bilious emesis and several loose bowel movements. No fever or chills were reported.
medical_history.past_medical_history: Hypertension (HTN), Hyperlipidemia (HLD), Osteopenia, Acid reflux, Peripheral vascular disease (PVD).
